summary: The Office of Management and Budget's "Reduce the Footprint" policy promotes reducing federal office space and managing it more efficiently to help keep costs down. OMB and the General Services Administration (the government's main landlord) try to measure the policy's effects by tracking changes in the average cost per square foot of federal space. We found GSA and OMB didn't use readily available actual cost...
title: Federal Real Property: Measuring Actual Office Space Costs Would Provide More Accurate Information
